intro: Pulsatilloides capensis, commonly known as the Cape pulsatilla, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with a hairy, globe-shaped structure. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces a capsule fruit that contains numerous small seeds. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often found in mountainous regions of the Western and Eastern Cape provinces.
